parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I entertain a stranger, (b) I startle, bewilder. From xenos; to be a host; by implication, be strange.
Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.
Simon. Of Hebrew origin; Simon, the name of nine Israelites.
A tanner. From bursa; a tanner.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Masculine Singular

str2: From oikos; properly, residence, but usually an abode; by implication, a family.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.
Probably prolonged from hals; the sea.
